newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia Hipotekarna Banka down 9.97 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia Hipotekarna Banka down 9.97 pct.

text.p: Preferred shares of Slovenian bank Hipotekarna Banka Brezice slumped 9.97 percent to 2,800 tolars on Tuesday, and market participants warned the share could fall further as investors remained wary of small banks.
"The share is very illiquid, and if anyone wants to sell the price often falls as nobody is eager to buy shares of small banks since the bankruptcy of Komercialna Banka Triglav(KBT)," said a trader.
KBT went into bankruptcy last July after running into liquidity problems, prompting a widespread mistrust of smaller banks in the country's overcrowded financial sector.
Hipotekarna is one of the smallest among Slovenia's 28 banks.

An analyst said Hipotekarna's preferred shares could fall to 2,200 tolars in the worst case but added the short term outlook would depend on the bank's 1996 business results, which have yet to be released. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
